intro: Diacrium bicornutum var. indivisum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diacrium, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific alpine regions. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant exhibits a unique adaptation to high-altitude environments, with a compact growth form and dense foliage to reduce wind exposure. Its reproductive structures are highly specialized, with flowers that rely on specific pollinators for fertilization. Due to its limited geographic range and fragile habitat, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation assessments.
